messages.message: @shiqi do you mean data in the database? Or data in the file system?

~and is this for the enterprise UATs or AI Hub UATs? Most enterprise UATs depend extensively on data in the IB Eng test drive~
From the Testmo run, looks like it's enterprise UATs
@andy I saw you marked the Classifier UATs as passing. The cypress tests go to a specific drive location though, so I don't think they would pass on a fresh environment?
oh good catch. i think i broadly marked that whole folder as passing when i was skimming through

@lydia thanks for asking, it is both db and file system, we want to know what we need to keep on our list to migrate when we move enterprise UAT to a release sandbox in AWS, so anything that won't work out of the box would be something we need to setup, note this does not include the infra setup (e.g. some of the golden tests only need NFS to be enabled, we will make sure they are enabled on the new environment but if the test is expecting certain content already there, that will be something we need help to identify)
Also this is for enterprise UAT only, aihub UAT is already in AWS so nothing is changing there.
and if you are unsure, feel free to use one of the current release sandbox such as https://release-24-01.internal.instabase.com/ to double check
i marked things as passing if it was relatively trivial for testers to re-upload the files or do certain quick set up operations for those UATs
awesome, yeah if they can be easily setup by the tester then it will be great to save us some time to migrate :pray:
